title: of the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the National Archives Act 1986 (Section
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Archives Act 1986 (Section 

8(1A)) (Transfer of Departmental Records) (No. 3) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited national archive act 1986 (section 8(1a)) (transfer departmental records) (no 3) order 2022

title: of the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 1 January 2023.
text_raw: 2. This Order shall come into operation on 1 January 2023.

title: of the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 1986) (as adapted by the Culture,
heading: 3. The following class of Departmental records which are less than 30
text_raw:
3. The following class of Departmental records which are less than 30 
years old but more than 20 years old, namely Anglo Irish records relating to the 
peace process and Northern Ireland, including Departmental records relating to 
the Good Friday Agreement, for the period from 1 January 1999 to 31 
December 2002, that are held by the Department of Foreign Affairs, shall be 
transferred, in accordance with the National Archives Act 1986 (No. 11 of 
1986), to the National Archives. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 16th December, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Taoiseach consents to the making of the foregoing Order. 

[662] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal 

of the Taoiseach, 

1 December, 2022. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Order. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister 

for Public Expenditure and Reform, 

2 December, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

The Minister for Foreign Affairs consents to the making of the foregoing 
Order. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister 

for Foreign Affairs, 
6 December, 2022. 

SIMON COVENEY, 

Minister for Foreign Affairs. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [662] 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

7 December, 2022. 

CATHERINE MARTIN, 

Minister for Tourism, Culture, Arts, 

Gaeltacht, Sport and Media. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [662] 5
